title: Modi attends ceremonial welcome for President Dissanayake at Rashtrapati Bhavan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, on his maiden foreign visit since assuming office, was accorded a grand ceremonial welcome at the Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi, the official residence of the Indian President, earlier today (16).

title: Justice Minister files complaint with CID over false information on Parliament website
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration, Attorney-at-Law Harshana Nanayakkara lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (16) regarding the publication of incorrect information on the official website of the Parliament of Sri Lanka.

title: Lanka T10 match-fixing scandal: Indian team owner to make confidential statement to court
byline: The Indian owner of the ‘Galle Marvels’ team in the Lanka T10 Super League, who was arrested on Thursday (12) over match-fixing allegations, has been ordered to be further remanded until December 18 after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (16).

title: 17-year-old girl killed in road accident in Kandy
byline: A 17-year-old girl has died following a road accident on William Gopallawa Mawatha in Kandy early this morning (16).

title: President Dissanayake meets Indian PM
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held bilateral discussions with the Indian Prime Minister, Narendra Modi, in New Delhi, during his state visit to India.

title: Sri Lanka and India sign MoU to avoid double taxation
byline: Sri Lanka and India today exchanged a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to avoid double taxation and to train Sri Lankan civil administrators at the Indian National Centre for Good Governance.

title: India will supply LNG to Sri Lanka’s power plants, announces PM Modi
byline: India plans to supply liquefied natural gas to Sri Lanka’s power plants and will work on connecting the power grids of the two countries as well as lay a petroleum pipeline between the neighbours, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced on Monday.

title: Modi assures India’s continued economic support for Sri Lanka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended an invitation to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit Sri Lanka, during the joint media briefing held in New Delhi this afternoon (16).

title: ASPI crosses 14,500 points to set new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has exceeded the 14,500-points mark for the first time in history.

title: Death toll in Gaza Strip from Israel-Hamas war tops 45,000, Palestinians say
byline: The death toll in the Gaza Strip from the 14-month war between Israel and Hamas militants has topped 45,000 people, Palestinian health officials said Monday, with 52 dead arriving at hospitals across the bombed-out strip over the past 24 hours.

title: Landslide early warnings issued for 4 districts
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for multiple areas in several districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Man sentenced to 12 years RI for importing ecstasy pills
byline: The Colombo High Court today sentenced a defendant to 12 years of rigorous imprisonment after he was found guilty over the importation of over 5,000 ecstasy pills into the country from France in 2020.

title: President Dissanayake may reconsider 13A - Austin Fernando
byline: The Former Sri Lankan High Commissioner to India, Austin Fernando, claims that there is a possibility that incumbent President Anura Dissanayake may reconsider the 13th Amendment to the Constitution when proposing a new Constitution.

title: CAA conducts 342 raids on rice traders; fines imposed over 6
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) says that 342 raids have been carried out so far ahead of the festive season with regard to selling rice above the controlled price.

title: Bitcoin tops $106,000, hopes grow for strategic reserve
byline: Bitcoin hit a record high above $106,000 on Monday after President-elect Donald Trump suggested he plans to create a U.S. bitcoin strategic reserve similar to its strategic oil reserve, stoking the enthusiasm of crypto bulls.

title: New Speaker to be elected tomorrow after new MPs take oath
byline: Parliament will convene tomorrow (17) where a new Speaker shall be elected following the Oaths and Affirmation of new Members of Parliament as provided by Standing Orders and the Constitution, said the Secretary General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadeera.

title: President AKD meets India’s Vice President and Health Minister
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held a meeting with Indian Vice-President, Jagdeep Dhankhar this afternoon (16).

title: Maximum retail prices to be imposed on several key items - Minister
byline: Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe says the government has decided to impose maximum retail prices on a range of essential items in the future.

title: 27 Sri Lankans rescued from Myanmar cybercrime camps return home
byline: A group of 27 Sri Lankans, including eight women, who were victims of human traffickers in Myanmar, has returned to the country today (16).

title: Indian President hosts banquet in honor of President Dissanayake
byline: Indian President Droupadi Murmu has received Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi and hosted a banquet in his honor.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the low-pressure area over southwest Bay of Bengal is located to the east of the island as of this morning (17), and it is expected to gradually move west-northwestwards, moving towards the Tamil Nadu coast near the northern coast of Sri Lanka during the next 48 hours.

title: Gazette issued confirming Asoka Ranwala’s resignation as Speaker
byline: The official Gazette notification confirming the resignation of Asoka Ranwala from the position of Speaker of Parliament has been issued, signed by the Secretary to the President, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake.

title: Teacher and teenage student killed in shooting at Christian school in Wisconsin
byline: A teenage student opened fire with a handgun Monday at a Christian school in Wisconsin, killing a teacher and another teenager during the final week before Christmas break. The shooter also died, police said.

title: President engages in talks with Indian business leaders
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, currently on a three-day official visit to India, participated in a discussion with leading Indian business representatives yesterday (16) in New Delhi.

title: General Election candidates’ expense reports to be publicized from today
byline: The Election Commission says that the election expense reports of all candidates, party secretaries, independent group leaders and national list candidates who contested the 2024 General Election will be made public from today onwards (17).

title: Four arrested over Meetiyagoda shooting
byline: Police have arrested four suspects in connection with the shooting incident that took place in the Mahawatta area of Meetiyagoda.

title: Sri Lanka and Malaysia discuss investment opportunities and tourism
byline: High Commissioner of Malaysia to Sri Lanka, Badli Hisham bin Adam has met with Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Prime Minister”s Office to discuss avenues for enhancing economic, cultural, and tourism ties between the two nations.

title: Jagath Wickremeratne appointed new Speaker
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has been unanimously appointed as the new Speaker of Sri Lanka’s Parliament.

title: Four new MPs sworn in
byline: Four new National List Members of Parliament were sworn in before the Deputy Speaker this morning (17).

title: Sri Lanka’s bondholders sign off on USD 12.55 billion debt overhaul
byline: Sri Lanka’s bondholders signed off on the government’s proposal to restructure its $12.55 billion of international bonds, a key step in finalising the island nation’s debt rework.

title: Dayasiri summoned to SLFP’s disciplinary committee
byline: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party’s (SLFP) disciplinary committee has summoned Member of Parliament Dayasiri Jayasekara, the party’s General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake said.

title: Sri Lanka’s ambitious governance and macro-linked bonds explained
byline: Sri Lanka’s restructuring of $12.55 billion in international bond debt is set to lead to the launch of a series of new, as-yet-untested instruments linked to economic growth and governance.

title: New Speaker urges ruling and opposition parties to collaborate for national progress
byline: The newly-appointed Speaker of Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, says he will have to take on a challenging role in fulfilling his responsibility as a legislator for the greater good.

title: Bomb kills chief of Russian nuclear protection forces in Moscow
byline: A bomb hidden in an electric scooter killed a senior Russian general in charge of nuclear protection forces in Moscow on Tuesday, Russia’s investigative committee said.

title: Tri-forces security for ex-Presidents to be withdrawn from next week
byline: The tri-forces personnel assigned to provide security to former presidents will be withdrawn from next week and only police security will continue to be provided, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala said.

title: TikTok asks Supreme Court for emergency order to block US ban unless it’s sold
byline: TikTok on Monday asked the Supreme Court to step in on an emergency basis to block the federal law that would ban the popular platform in the United States unless its China-based parent company agreed to sell it.

title: ‘Wicked’ part two has been titled ‘Wicked: For Good’, film to release in November 2025
byline: The second part of musical fantasy movie Wicked has been titled Wicked: For Good, Hollywood studio Universal Pictures has announced.

title: Indictments filed against biomedical engineer attached to Health Ministry
byline: Indictments have been filed before the Colombo High Court today (17) against a biomedical engineer attached to the Division of Biomedical Engineering Services at the Ministry of Health, alleging that he caused financial losses to the government through the purchase of 35 operating room lamps in 2015.

title: Petition challenging Archchuna’s MP post fixed for consideration
byline: The Court of Appeal fixed for consideration on January 15, 2025 a quo warranto petition filed seeking a writ order disqualifying Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna from holding a parliamentary seat.

title: Opposition focusing on govt MPs’ qualifications due to absence of corruption – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says the opposition is focusing on looking into the qualifications of ruling party MPs due to their inability to find corruption within the National People’s Power (NPP) government.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy grows 5.5% in 2024 Q3
byline: The year-on-year GDP growth rate for the third quarter of 2024 has been reported as 5.5 percent of positive growth rate, the Department of Census and Statistics indicated.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy grows 5.5% in Q3 2024
byline: The year-on-year GDP growth rate for the third quarter of 2024 has been reported as 5.5 percent of positive growth rate, the Department of Census and Statistics indicated.

title: Sajith to present all his educational qualifications to Parliament tomorrow
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa stated in Parliament today (17) that he will present all of his educational qualification certificates to the House tomorrow morning (18).

title: Vanuatu hit by magnitude 7.4 earthquake, UN reports six unconfirmed deaths
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 7.4 struck Vanuatu’s capital Port Vila on Tuesday, with the United Nations reporting six unconfirmed deaths and that two reservoirs and a hospital had been damaged.

title: President Dissanayake offers prayer at Mahabodhi Temple
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently on an official visit to India, arrived in Bodh Gaya this morning (17).
